title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: In a first, a gene therapy seems to slow Huntington disease
items.description: Small study suggests uniQure drug could be first successful treatment for devastating brain disorder

items.title: A ‘solar bump’ could help data centers recover wasted energy
items.description: Solar water heaters could recoup 8% of the electricity needs of AI computer farms

items.title: Storied atom-smasher that makes tiny Big Bangs wraps up mission
items.description: For 26 years, the Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider has re-created the quark-gluon plasma that filled the infant universe

items.title: Thousands of quakes struck a major Greek volcano, mapping the plumbing beneath it
items.description: A “crisis” that rocked the island of Santorini may reveal a shared magma system between two volcanoes with explosive histories

items.title: Trump’s autism initiative embraces little-tested vitamin as a treatment
items.description: FDA to approve leucovorin despite questions about whom it might help

items.title: Ethicists flirt with AI to review human research
items.description: Large language models could help reduce backlog of study proposals, but critics are wary of entrusting ethics to machines

items.title: U.S. court orders NIH to restore killed grants to California researchers
items.description: Judge says district court is proper forum to protest mass grant terminations

items.title: Whose papers have an edge at Science? In unusual study, journal looks in the mirror
items.description: Confidential data show being in the U.S., at a prestigious institution, and in a large team all may help

items.title: Trump visa policy requires universities to pay huge fee to hire foreign scholars
items.description: U.S. employers to pay $100,000 for every new H-1B visa

items.title: Even subzero parts of the Arctic are thawing. Ancient salt is the culprit
items.description: Long-buried layers of saline permafrost seem to be accelerating climate change's transformation of the Arctic
